New Records: Freddie Freeman hit the first walk-off grand slam in World Series history.
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam with two outs in the bottom of the 10th inning secured a 6-3 victory for the Dodgers.
Giancarlo Stanton hit a two-run home run for the Yankees.
Jazz Chisholm gave the Yankees the lead in the 10th inning by singling, stealing second and third, and scoring on a grounder.
Shohei Ohtani hit a double and scored on a sacrifice fly by Mookie Betts.
Alex Verdugo made a brilliant catch by tumbling into the stands.
A Dodgers fan interfered with a ball hit by Gleyber Torres, resulting in a ground-rule double after review.
Pre-Game Insights: The World Series features five MVPs: Shohei Ohtani, Freddie Freeman, Mookie Betts, Aaron Judge, and Giancarlo Stanton.
This is the first World Series featuring both likely MVPs of the year, Ohtani and Judge.
The rivalry between the Dodgers and Yankees dates back to 1941.
Fernando Valenzuela's family was honored on the field before the game.
Brad Paisley performed the National Anthem.
Gerrit Cole talked about his dream of playing for the Yankees and facing the Dodgers in the World Series.
Aaron Judge expressed his excitement for his first World Series.
David Ortiz, Derek Jeter, and Alex Rodriguez discussed the pressure on both teams heading into the World Series.
Post-Match Reflections: Nestor Cortes, who had not pitched since September 18 due to an elbow injury, returned to pitch in the World Series, risking further injury for the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The flags at Dodger Stadium were at half-mast in honor of Fernando Valenzuela, who passed away earlier in the week.
This is the first World Series between the Dodgers and Yankees in 43 years.
The game featured a tense, back-and-forth affair with multiple lead changes and dramatic moments.
